post.description:
This method can be used to copy a model from one location to another. If the target subscription
key belongs to a subscription created for another location, the model will be copied to that location.
Only adapted models are allowed to copy to another subscription.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Format - uuid. The identifier of the model that will be copied.

parameters.name: modelCopy
parameters.description: The body contains the subscription key of the target subscription.

201.description: The response contains the location of the entity as header.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

401.description: In case the user isn't authorized.

403.description: In case authorized user isn't known or doesn't have the required permissions.

404.description: In case the specified entity doesn't exist

429.description: In case the rate limit has been exceeded.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before not getting this response anymore.

post.description: Uploads data and creates a new dataset.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The optional string representation of the url of a project. If set, the dataset will be associated with that project.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: The name of this data import (required).

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Optional description of this data import.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale of this data import (required).

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: The kind of the data import (required).

parameters.name: customProperties
parameters.description: The optional custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: For acoustic data imports, a zip file containing the audio data and a text file containing the transcriptions for the audio data. for language data imports, a text file containing the language or pronunciation data. Required in both cases.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: An optional string containing the email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes. The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

post.description:
If the property secret in the configuration is present and contains a non-empty string, it will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. This hash will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.
            
When calling back into the registered URL, the request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header containing one of the registered event
types. There will be one request per registered event type.
            
After successfully registering the web hook, it will not be usable until a challenge/response is completed. To do this, a request with the event type
challenge will be made with a query parameter called validationToken. Respond to the challenge with a 200 OK containing the value of the validationToken
query parameter as the response body. When the challenge/response is successfully completed, the web hook will begin receiving events.

parameters.name: webHook
parameters.description: The details of the new web hook.

201.description: The response contains the location of the entity as header.

delete.description: Deletion process is done asynchronously and can take up to one day depending on the amount of log files.
delete.summary: Delete All Base Model Endpoint Logs

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The language used to select the default base model.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
The end date of the audio logs deletion (specific day, UTC).
            Expected format: "yyyy-mm-dd". for instance, "2019-09-20" results in deleting all logs on September 20h, 2019 and before.
            Deletes all existing logs when date is not specified.

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

401.description: In case the user isn't authorized.

403.description: In case authorized user isn't known or doesn't have the required permissions.

404.description: In case the specified entity doesn't exist

429.description: In case the rate limit has been exceeded.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before not getting this response anymore.

get.description: Gets the list of audio and transcription logs that have been stored when using the default base model of a given language.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The language used to select the default base model.

parameters.name: sasValidityInSeconds
parameters.description: Format - int32. The duration in seconds that an SAS url should be valid. The default duration is 12 hours.

parameters.name: skipToken
parameters.description: Token to skip logs that were already retrieved in previous requests. Pagination starts from beginning when not defined.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Format - int32. Number of files that will be included (between 1 and 5000).

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

patch.description:
If the property secret in the configuration is omitted or contains an empty string, future callbacks won't contain X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature
headers. If the property contains a non-empty string, it will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with the secret as HMAC key. This hash
will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.
            
If the URL changes,  the web hook will stop receiving events until a
challenge/response is completed. To do this, a request with the event type challenge will be made with a query parameter called validationToken.
Respond to the challenge with a 200 OK containing the value of the validationToken query parameter as the response body. When the challenge/response
is successfully completed, the web hook will begin receiving events.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Format - uuid. The identifier of the web hook.

parameters.name: webHookUpdate
parameters.description: The updated values for the web hook.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait for a non terminal operation to complete.

post.description:
The request body of the POST request sent to the registered web hook URL is of the same shape as in the GET request for a specific hook.
The Swagger Schema ID of the model is WebHookV3.
            
The request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header with the value ping. If the web hook was registered with
a secret it will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header with an SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. The hash is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Format - uuid. The identifier of the web hook to ping.

202.description: Started trying to send a ping request to the web hook.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

401.description: In case the user isn't authorized.

403.description: In case authorized user isn't known or doesn't have the required permissions.

404.description: In case the specified entity doesn't exist

429.description: In case the rate limit has been exceeded.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before not getting this response anymore.

post.description:
The payload will be generated from the last entity that would have invoked the web hook. If no entity is present for none of the registered event types,
the POST will respond with 204. If a test request can be made, it will respond with 200.
The request will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Event header with the respective registered event type.
If the web hook was registered with a secret it will contain a X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header with an SHA256 hash of the payload with
the secret as HMAC key. The hash is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Format - uuid. The identifier of the web hook to ping.

202.description: A test request with the last entity is sent to the registered web hook.

Location.description: The location of the created resource.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before accessing the resource created in this operation.

204.description: No entity could be found for any event type, so no test request is sent to the registered web hook.

400.description: In case the operation cannot be performed successfully with the specified values.

401.description: In case the user isn't authorized.

403.description: In case authorized user isn't known or doesn't have the required permissions.

404.description: In case the specified entity doesn't exist

429.description: In case the rate limit has been exceeded.

Retry-After.description: The minimum number of seconds to wait before not getting this response anymore.

Dataset.title: Dataset

links.description: The links for additional actions or content related to this dataset.

properties.description: Additional configuration options when creating a new dataset and additional metadata provided by the service.

displayName.description: The display name of the object.

project.description: The project, the dataset is associated with.

contentUrl.description: The URL of the data for the dataset.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

Dataset.example:
{
  "kind": "Acoustic",
  "contentUrl": "https://contoso.com/location",
  "locale": "en-US",
  "displayName": "My speech dataset name",
  "description": "My speech dataset description"
}

files.description: The location to get all files of this entity.

acceptedLineCount.description: The number of lines accepted for this data set.

rejectedLineCount.description: The number of lines rejected for this data set.

duration.description:
The total duration of the datasets if it contains audio files. The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration
("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

error.description: The details of the error in case the entity is in a failed state.

self.description: The location of the referenced entity.

project.description: The project, the entity is associated with.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

values.description:
A list of entities limited by either the passed query parameters 'skip' and 'top' or their default values.
            
When iterating through a list using pagination and deleting entities in parallel, some entities will be skipped in the results.
It's recommended to build a list on the client and delete after the fetching of the complete list.

@nextLink.description: A link to the next set of paginated results if there are more entities available; otherwise null.

(see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

restDictation.description: The REST endpoint for requests up to 60 seconds, supporting dictation of punctuation marks.

webSocketConversation.description: The Speech SDK endpoint for long requests with multiple final results.

webSocketDictation.description:
The Speech SDK endpoint for long requests with multiple final results, supporting dictation of
punctuation marks.

logs.description: The audio and transcription logs for this endpoint.

loggingEnabled.description: A value indicating whether content logging (audio & transcriptions) is being used for a deployment.

timeToLive.description:
How long the endpoint will be kept in the system. Once the endpoint reaches the time to live
after completion (successful or failed) it will be automatically deleted. Not setting this value or setting
to 0 will disable automatic deletion.
The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration ("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

manifest.description: The location to get a manifest for this model to be used in the on-prem container.

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

error.description: The details of the error in case the entity is in a failed state.

ErrorContent.title: ErrorContent
ErrorContent.description: The interface represents the content of an error response defined in the OneAPI v2.1 documentation.

details.description: An array of details representing distinct related errors that occured during the request.

innererror.description:
The stack trace of the error. The payload is service-defined.
If the error is not at the root level, the object contains a Code
and an InnerError property.

code.description:
A service-defined error code that should be human-readable.
This code serves as a more specific indicator of the error than
the HTTP error code specified in the response.

message.description:
A human-readable representation of the error. It is intended as
an aid to developers and is not suitable for exposure to end users.

target.description: The target of the particular error (e.g., the name of the property in error).

ErrorDetail.description: An array of implementations of this interface can be used as details for an error.

When iterating through a list using pagination and deleting entities in parallel, some entities will be skipped in the results.
It's recommended to build a list on the client and delete after the fetching of the complete list.

Transcription.title: Transcription

links.description: The links for additional actions or content related to this transcription.

properties.description: Additional configuration options when creating a new transcription and additional metadata provided by the service.

model.description: The model used in this transcription.

project.description: The project, the transcription is associated with.

dataset.description: A list of acoustic or audio files datasets containing the audio files that will be transcribed.

contentUrls.description:
A list of content urls to get audio files from for transcription. Up to 1000 urls are allowed.
This property will not be returned in a response.

contentContainerUrl.description:
A URL for an Azure blob container that contains the audio files. A container is allowed to have a maximum size of 5GB and a maximum number of 10000 blobs.
The maximum size for a blob is 2.5GB. 
Container SAS should contain 'r' (read) and 'l' (list) permissions. 
This property will not be returned in a response.

displayName.description: The display name of the object.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

locale.description: The locale of the contained data.

lastActionDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the current status was entered.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

createdDateTime.description:
The time-stamp when the object was created.
The time stamp is encoded as ISO 8601 date and time format
("YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations).

diarizationEnabled.description: A value indicating whether diarization (speaker separation) is requested.

wordLevelTimestampsEnabled.description: A value indicating whether word level timestamps are requested.

duration.description:
The duration of the transcription. The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration
("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

channels.description:
A collection of the requested channel numbers.
In the default case, the channels 0 and 1 are considered.

timeToLive.description:
How long the transcription will be kept in the system. Once the transcription reaches the time to live
after completion (successful or failed) it will be automatically deleted. Not setting this value or setting
to 0 will disable automatic deletion.
The duration is encoded as ISO 8601 duration ("PnYnMnDTnHnMnS", see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

email.description:
The email address to send email notifications to in case the operation completes.
The value will be removed after successfully sending the email.

error.description: The details of the error in case the entity is in a failed state.

project.description: The project, the entity is associated with.

customProperties.description:
The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum
allowed value length is 256 characters and the count of allowed entries is 10.

The custom properties of this entity. The maximum allowed key length is 64 characters, the maximum

ping.description: The URL that can be used to trigger the sending of a ping event to the registered URL of a web hook registration.

test.description: The URL that can be used sending test events to the registered URL of a web hook registration.

error.description: The details of the error in case the dataset is in a failed state.

apiVersion.description:
The API version the web hook was created in. This defines the shape of the payload in the callbacks.
If the payload type is not supported anymore, because the shape changed and the API version using it is removed (after deprecation),
the web hook will be disabled.

secret.description:
A secret that will be used to create a SHA256 hash of the payload with the secret as HMAC key.
This hash will be set as X-MicrosoftSpeechServices-Signature header when calling back into the registered URL.
